items.content_html:
This was renamed at the CSSWG w3c/csswg-drafts#11645 (comment) and the change landed in Chrome 136.0.7062.0 in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6333420.

I am not sure on the following though:

  • How to communicate that raw-string only works from Chrome 136 onwards? BCD would need to reflect that, I guess?
  • There is no real explanation what the difference between a CSS string and a CSS <string> is, but I believe that could be part of the page on CSS data types.

There is also a drive-by commit that describes how * behaves, as that is related to the use of raw-string vs <string>
items.title: CSS `attr()`: Rename `string` to `raw-string`

items.content_html:
Description

The HEADERS_RECEIVED property can be obtained from an instance of XMLHttpRequest.

At this point, the this of the arrow function might be window or undefined . Therefore, it does not have HEADERS_RECEIVED property.
items.title: Fix: the `this` of the arrow function does not have HEADERS_RECEIVED property

items.content_html:
Description

Updated the <!doctype html> declaration to in the HTML Code Style Guide to align with standard conventions and best practices.

Motivation

The uppercase is the widely accepted format for declaring the document type in HTML5. Ensuring consistency helps avoid confusion among readers and follows best coding practices.
items.title: Corrected doctype declaration to uppercase in HTML Code Style Guide

items.content_html:
Description

MDN has three lists that enumerate all CSS pseudo-classes, but none of the lists include all pesudo-classes. I have added the missing pseudo-classes to all three lists.

I have also made some minor tweaks:

  • edited the spec links because the old spec links were incorrect.
  • moved a few pesudo-classes around because they were not in alphabetical order.
  • removed/added the experimental icon from pesudo-classes where it was incorrect.
  • edited the descriptions of :playing and :paused because they were very long and incorrect.
  • edited the names and links of a few pseudo-classes that had incorrect names or links.

Motivation

The lists are confusing and misleading when they are incomplete.

Additional details

A few of the new pseudo-classes do not link anywhere because MDN does not have a page for that pseudo-element. I tried to add the link anyways because I expect that the pages will be added in the future, but then the links are redirected to other pseudo-classes that start with the same letters. I think that would create a bad user experience, so I have opted to not add any links instead.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Fix CSS pseudo-class lists

items.content_html:
Problem

In the weekly spelling check bot, the current scheme of reporting each word on a separate line with corresponding file is generating massive logs. If someone adds a different version of lorem ipsum then it breaks the GitHub workflow with an error

GraphQL: Body is too long (maximum is 65536 characters) (createIssue)

https://github.com/mdn/content/actions/runs/13753835872/job/38458187038#step:5:876

Solution

Instead of having file-word combinations, have file-words combinations. That is, list a file path followed by the list of unknown words in it. It will reduce files x words lines to only files.

For example, the equivalent outcome of the failed workflow would be:

  • files/en-us/learn_web_development/howto/solve_html_problems/use_javascript_within_a_webpage/index.md - Unknown words (Matuzovic)
  • files/en-us/web/api/performance_api/monitoring_bfcache_blocking_reasons/index.md - Unknown words (idbversionchangeevent, idledetector, keyboardlock, otpcredential, pictureinpicturewindow, smartcardconnection, speechrecognition, webhid, webxrdevice)
  • files/en-us/web/api/trusted_types_api/index.md - Unknown words (tinyfill)
  • files/en-us/web/css/_colon_first-child/index.md - Unknown words (Adhemar, Blankers, Bubka, Gebrselassie, Haile, Irena, Junxia, Kersee, Koen, Paavo, Szewinska, Usain, Zatopek)
  • files/en-us/web/css/_colon_lang/index.md - Unknown words (czaszką, lepiej, napisem, narysowaną, wchodzić, widzimy, znak, środka)
  • files/en-us/web/css/_colon_last-child/index.md - Unknown words (Adhemar, Blankers, Bubka, Gebrselassie, Haile, Irena, Junxia, Kersee, Koen, Paavo, Szewinska, Usain, Zatopek)
  • files/en-us/web/css/_colon_nth-child/index.md - Unknown words (Adhemar, Blankers, Bubka, Gebrselassie, Haile, Irena, Junxia, Kersee, Koen, Paavo, Szewinska, Usain, Zatopek)
  • files/en-us/web/css/_colon_nth-last-child/index.md - Unknown words (Cloquet, Hinckley, Kursha, Miramichi, Peshtigo)
  • files/en-us/web/css/_colon_only-child/index.md - Unknown words (Downey, Scarlett)
  • files/en-us/web/css/_doublecolon_after/index.md - Unknown words (Indo, scorpionfish)
  • files/en-us/web/css/_doublecolon_first-letter/index.md - Unknown words (Robison, dragonfish)
  • files/en-us/web/css/_doublecolon_first-line/index.md - Unknown words (Exocoetidae)
  • files/en-us/web/css/_doublecolon_marker/index.md - Unknown words (Deke, Gordo, Grissom, Schirra, Slayton)
  • files/en-us/web/css/animation/index.md - Unknown words (slidein)
  • files/en-us/web/css/clip-path/index.md - Unknown words (Aéro)
  • files/en-us/web/css/counter/index.md - Unknown words (Bron, Dwyane, Giancarlo, Iniesta, Xavi)
  • files/en-us/web/css/css_conditional_rules/container_scroll-state_queries/index.md - Unknown words (Aristonem, Aristoxeni, Atqui, Beatus, Conferam, Duarum, Falli, Huius, Lyco, Memini, Metrodori, Nescio, Neutrum, Omnes, Omnia, Pisonem, Polemonis, Praeteritis, Prioris, Putabam, Quonam, Rationis, Tria, Triarium, Videmus, abducam, adesse, aequius, agas, altera, angustiarum, apertissimis, apparet, auctoritatem, beate, bonorum, capienda, causa, censent, commendas, concedamus, conquiescere, consumptum, controversia, controversiam, cuique, deinde, dicitis, dicitur, dicuntur, differt, discipulum, dissensio, dissensione, disseramus, dissimile, dixisse, dixisset, docilitas, eiusdem, equidem, erit, erunt, expositum, faciam, faciat, falsone, finem, fingunt, futtiles, gaudeo, haec, hilaretur, homines, ielunior, igitur, ille, infantes, ingenium, inprudens, instituta, ipsis, istarum, iucundum, iudicare, iustitia, laboro, laudatur, leves, liberius, liberos, locuples, longi, loqui, maior, maximarum, melius, memoria, motum, musicis, natos, nimium, nomine, occurrentia, oculis, omnes, oportere, oportunitatis, oratione, paria, peccata, pecuniae, perfectio, pertinacem, philosophiae, philosophos, possint, possumus, potest, potestne, praetervolavit, privasse, pulsi, putas, quaerere, recurrant, redargueret, reperies, ridens, saepius, satis, satisfacit, sensus, sequens, sequuntur, sordidos, subicias, subtilius, sumus, superiori, tantae, targetting, timore, utebare, utilitatem, vanos, veniunt, vere, videmus, vides, vincunt, vitarum, vivere)
  • files/en-us/web/css/font-optical-sizing/index.md - Unknown words (slablike)
  • files/en-us/web/css/shape-image-threshold/index.md - Unknown words (Aéro)
  • files/en-us/web/css/shape-margin/index.md - Unknown words (Aéro)
  • files/en-us/web/css/shape-outside/index.md - Unknown words (Aéro)
  • files/en-us/web/css/white-space/index.md - Unknown words (stept)
  • files/en-us/web/html/element/aside/index.md - Unknown words (rainforest)
  • files/en-us/web/html/element/mark/index.md - Unknown words (rainforest)
  • files/en-us/web/svg/element/discard/index.md - Unknown words (Dahlström's)

A custom CSpell reporter

  • As suggested in the streetsidesoftware/cspell#7006 discussion, I've created a custom group-by-file reporter that can be used to reduce the size of the opening post of the weekly spelling check GitHub issues.
items.title: ci(cspell-bot): group words by file to reduce log size

items.content_html:
Description

The maxInterStageShaderComponents WebGPU limit is deprecated in Chrome 133 onwards; see https://developer.chrome.com/blog/new-in-webgpu-133#deprecate_maxinterstageshadercomponents_limit and https://issues.chromium.org/issues/364338810 for details.

This PR marks it as deprecated (and non-standard) and provides a link to more information about the deprecation. It is already marked as deprecated in BCD.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #38411
items.title: Editorial review: mark maxInterStageShaderComponents as deprecated, provide more info

items.content_html:
Description

Chrome 132 supports the GPUDevice.adapterInfo property. See https://developer.chrome.com/blog/new-in-webgpu-132#gpudevice_adapterinfo_attribute and https://chromestatus.com/feature/6221851301511168 for info.

This PR documents the new property and adjusts some of the surrounding info as appropriate.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #38363
items.title: Editorial review: Document GPUDevice.adapterInfo property

items.content_html:
There is a typo in the description for the HTTP COOP header, for the case of opening a page in a popup (using window.open() that makes the table wrong.

The steps come from https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/browsers.html#check-browsing-context-group-switch-coop-value-popup. I suspect that when I did this I wanted to make this "when do we open in a different BCG" to match the navigation case. But it is far less risky to match the behaviour in the spec and avoid introducing more complicated issues.
items.title: Fix up COOP HTTP header errors

items.content_html:
Description

This change fixes an inaccurate composite transformation description for
an example. Additionally the percentages mentioned in the description
didn't match what was used in the at-rule, so those were changed as well
to reflect the actual keyframes.

Motivation

While the description "matched" what the animation displays, it isn't
what happens under the hood when the transformations are applied, and
could confuse readers unfamiliar with chaining transforms. Specifically
the order described was incorrect as transforms are applied right to
left. Additionally the description said that the element was translated
along the "redirected X axis" which is misleading as rotate
transformations do not change an element's X axis orientation.

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #38537
items.title: Fix incorrect composite transformation description

This PR adds a couple of details about this feature.

Motivation

Additional details

items.title: Editorial review: Add details about float32-blendable WebGPU feature
